description:
This place has a very good slice. It's a great option for late night or low budget. I think two slices of cheese costs $5-6. 

However, I ordered a whole pie from this place once and it was not very good. I don't know what it was. Maybe they just threw it together too quickly or the lack of reheating each slice. Either way, the slice they reheat when you walk in is FAR superior. I've had the slices a few times and they've always been good.
author: Jo B.

description: Any pizza just get extra cheese and their ranch is super good too but quite small for how much they charge. Everything's good, but pricey.
author: Jess D.

description: The all meat pizza was filled with just sausage. The wings were undercooked & greasy. I'm pretty disappointed for how much this food cost me.
author: Chantel W.

description:
Love love love this place! Order a small and it looks like you ordered a medium. A small is enough food for two, but my husband and I still get our own.

We get our own because my health nut husband always orders a pizza with NO cheese. And I have to get one with extra cheese and pepperoni. Yum!! 

Fast delivery! Opens late! Good for late night munchies!! 

Great job pronto! You definitely have pronto service!!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Grabbed a pepperoni slice. Oh sooooooo good. The dough was soft and delicious. The area is a little sketch (they're opened until 3am, everyday) but that doesn't affect the quality of the pizza and service. Definitely returning in the drunken near future. 

The ONLY frustrating down side is the limited seating. Some punk ass white male party of 5 took my chair without asking. Luckily a homeless person refused to move from their table (he was there first). 

This occurrence shouldn't be held against the business. The fuckery literally happened while I was writing this review and so I felt like sharing.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great tasty pizza! baked wings were a bit soggy. nice guys working here. pretty quick and good family deal
author: Karen C.

description: Good place for late nite munchies. Got a sausage and pepperoni pizza that was perfectly cooked but my slice ripped apart whey I folded it for a bite.
author: M C.

description:
A hidden gem which hasn't been overrun by the hipsters of SF and therefore the prices are reasonable and the value is . 

Get the margherita pizza. Trust.
author: Rahul N.

description:
I've only been here once, but I was really pleased.  They made a special order chicken pesto slice for me in minutes, and it is probably the best pesto pizza I've had. 

Nice thin crust that tastes like there might be semolina flour involved. A perfect amount of pesto which accents but doesn't smother.  Good amount of chicken breast, cubed, and there's balance in every bite. 

Hefty sized slice and the meal was inexpensive.  Staff was friendly and amiable. 

No bathroom but the place still gets five stars, so you know it must bve good. Very neighborhood-informal.   Highly recommended place to break your diet.
author: David D.

description: Soggy breaded wings, overcooked pasta, and what tastes like frozen meatballs; just gross!
author: Manny F.

description: I ordered directly through the restaurant because it usually takes long if I order through Eat24/GrubHub/UberEats. Food came on time, I ordered the chicken sandwich with light pesto, fries, cheesecake and drink. There are little things I wish they had thought about like a fork or spoon to eat my cheesecake with, and napkins. I work at a front desk so these things aren't readily available here. But the food was delicious though.
author: Raquel T.

description: I don't know why I keep ordering from this place. I waited three hours tonight for my order. No one walked up my steps no one knocked on the door it is all so impersonal. I called Seamless and they sent me to Honduras to deal with customer service I cannot imagine a worse experience and my family went hungry, again
author: Doug W.

description: This is my favorite Tenderloin pizza.  Actually, it's one of my favorite places in the city to get a cheap slice of pizza.  I think their cheese pizza is everything a good slice should be and it reminds me of pizza from my home, New York.  5 dollars for a slice and a drink.  Love this pizza, writing this review makes me crave a hot, greasy slice right now.
author: Ellie H.

description: By no means the best pizza I've ever had. The food itself is pretty average but they are crazy cheap, deliver quickly and I've never had an issue with an order from them. They also have a more extensive menu than just pizza so that's also a plus.
author: Hannah G.

description:
'
Great Taste ' 
fast delivery and the delivery is very friendly 
We love to eat Pronto pizza thanks guys
Love love love love this stores pizza a lot than most of the pizza's I had.
author: Ershad S.

description: Excellent in all terms a pizza can be, I'm new to SFO and one of my friend referred Pronto Pizza in San Francisco.Many of my late night parties were successful with the delicious Pronto Pizza and it's on time delivery.I can recommend you all to try Pronto Pizza in store or Togo order where delivery is on time.
author: Shekar C.

description:
Came in here at 1030pm, ordered food and began to wait. Now I asked if it was halal (for those of you wondering ) and the cahsier said I don't know. That's not very good knowledge on someone that is working there. I been here before so I asked just to be safe.

I ordered a XL all meat pizza, garlic bread with cheese and philly cheese steak. So I sit down thinking since I'm the only one there, it won't be too long. I'm aware that there are pickup orders also but I still think it won't be too long. 

45 minutes later I finally receive food! So since it took so long I end up having it to go. 
The Philly steak was pretty disappointing, heavily flavored in sauce which is all you end up is tasting. 
The garlic bread with cheese was also disappointing, it was just dry with sprinkles of cheese spread on it.
The all meat pizza was actually decent, The one item I thought was prepared and made well. No extra oil or anything on it. It wasn't the best but it wasn't bad.

I went here because this is one of the few restaurants open late until 3AM. If you have a choice, I'd suggest somewhere else to spend your hard earned money.
author: Jason H.

description: The worst pizza that I've ever had. It's more stuffed crust than pizza and the crust was VERY soggy. The delivery sucked as the delivery person was incompetent.
author: Ienndiiggoma Y.

description:
Horrible service and rude!!
I called in for a pickup they said yes
I went in right on time
And they said they were busy that's why they couldn't get my order
I run a business and feed the homeless in my alleyway and was in a huge rush it ruined my day!
They wouldn't give me a discount either! So I bought a slice and it was terrible will never go back i advise you to call up and complain about this so they understand how bad it is for a business to not keep their word
author: John M.

description: 0 stars. Order (via Seamless) took 2 hours and 35 minutes to arrive and the food was soggy and cold. There were power outages today, so I called about 20 minutes after I made the order to confirm that the order was accepted and that they were online. They said they had the order and they were up and running with power, but it might be 20 minutes late. I said that was fine. It ended up being 2 hours late. I called the restaurant multiple times over the 2 hours, and got the same response every time: "It will be there in 10-15 minutes." Of course that was never true. Luckily Seamless has great customer service and they have given me some credits to make up for today, but don't order from this restaurant. The food sucks and so does the service.
author: Traci R.

description: One of the best pizza's in town. When ever I visit San Fransisco I will surely visit pronto for having pizza. I would love this place for food like damn high and the Delivery is also fast and never expected the pizza would arrive so fast .
author: Eshwar C.

description: Excellent pizza, great customer service, and afford prices. We found this gem after a concert at the regency ballroom and we will be returning!!! Stop by and support this lovely business. Don't be fooled if it doesn't look like a palace. It's delicious.
author: Kristina R.

description:
The pizza is mediocre at best. If you go in looking for a cheap meal without high expectations, then you'll find what you need. 

I docked points off for the rather terrible service. It took way too long to throw in a slice of pre-cooked pizza to warm up into the oven. The employee set it aside to be put into the oven, and went to the back of the kitchen for 10 minutes doing who knows what before warming up my slice. Meanwhile, the guy at the cashier is just watching TV.
author: Cory C.

description: Great Margarita Pizza, great customer service. Definitely I will recommend this great place 5stars
author: Angelique K.

description:
What I Liked:
Super inexpensive. About $3 for a cheese pizza and $.50 more for a singular topping.
 
Customer service was decent. 

What I Disliked:
The cheese pizza I ordered was just bread and cheese the sauce ratio was lacking and I wasn't really a fan of the fluffy dough. 

The place was super small but had some really loud individuals just hanging about not really eating just hanging out. Made it super uncomfortable to stay and enjoy my pizza.

Wasn't the cleanest environment. Seemed liked they didn't bus the tables often there were discarded coffee cups on the tables and empty parmesan cheese dispenser roaming about.

My friend ordered a pepperoni pizza and had the slimmest looking backed green leaf (could of been spinach) baked into her pizza. It was just so random and slimmy that she didn't want to finish that slice since it was an unidentified slimmy object....
author: Jenelle B.

description: In town on vacation, ordered delivery. One hour late. First time called, they hung up on me. Then told me on the way. Then it never came. They did not want to give money back either. Very very bad service. Do not order.
author: Loren B.

description:
Ordered delivery from here twice. 

Got the pronto pizza the first time and it was actually really good. I ordered two 1.5L of water with it but they only gave me a small bottle of water. 

The second time, we got a bbq chicken pizza, linguine with clams, chicken Alfredo and pizza sub. Everyone enjoyed their entrees. 

Not the best food in the world, but would order again.
author: Sunia C.

description: Food was delivered on time, hot and delicious. Was worried given some negative reviews on here but had a great experience. Will be back!
author: Dan P.

description: They allow drug dealers and addicts to use the bathroom, panhandle and harass customers, They turn the other way allow friends to walk back into the kitchen this is not only dirty it is illegal. Fed up with this place been coming here for years cant take it anymore. The night guy the late night one is rude and racist, he just stares when drug addicts harassed me for change that was the final straw, throw me under the bus then laugh. Bye, bye  Keep it.
author: Doc S.

description:
the WORST pizza place i have ever had in my entire life.  i have ordered delivery here for years.  poor delivery guy.  comes to my doorstep every week.  one day on july 4 (TODAY) for some odd reason my card doesn't work.  i used that card earlier today TOO!... anyway.  

may i repeat... i ordered pizza from them for 12 years in a row.  they DENIED me the pizza today.  so, so, so, hurt.  customers?  they don't care AT ALL.  CLEARLY.  i will never, ever, EVER, order from them again.

customer value = 0.  it's all about trust and patience.

PRONTO PIZZA = no patience and no trust.  PRONTO.

goodbye PRONTO.

YOU (PRONTO PIZZA) were phasing out anyway... IT'S about time.  GET OUT OF SAN FRANCISCO.  YOU DON'T DESERVE TO BE HERE.
author: Labonee M.

description:
I was trying to order some food for dinner with my family and pronto pizza's name came up on a list of pizzerias given to me by the Grubhub app. It was honestly my mistake for not double checking the ratings and reviews. 

I ordered a xx-large pronto pizza with a free 2-liter coke, mozzarella sticks, and a order of alfredo chicken fettuccine. The cost totaling at $53 + cash tip.

The pronto pizza was one of their most ordered  items which consists of pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, onions, bell peppers, and sausage. I got a 20" plain cheese pizza instead. Which is ridiculous because the pizza alone costed $31.

The chicken fettuccine was so watered down that it was pretty much chicken fettuccine soup and I'm not even exaggerating. 

Their delivery speed was fairly quick. It was an hour estimated and they got it here within 40 minutes. 

As far as ratings goes, if I can I would give it 0 stars but the staff knew it was their fault and delivered the correct pizza right away within 20-30 minutes. Even throwing in the pizza for free. So I'll give it one star for my experience. This was my first and last time ordering from pronto pizza.
author: Chris L.

description: This is Khalil from Argentina. I used to live near Pronto Pizza, and I had the best food from Abdo and Firas. Thanks!
author: Khalil M.

description:
Four stars for the fries and only the fries. I don't care if they're previously frozen. THESE are the fries that sing to my heart and my arteries. It's not that weird coated kind that you'll find everywhere nowadays. Just fries like you used to get from most places 20 years ago.

Skip the pizza and everything else. Get the fries.
author: Loli L.

description: Pretty darn good pizza pie.  I ordered extra cheese, green olives and jalepenos.....real good.  Sauce was great.  Cheese was great.   Most places don't offer green olives; but, that's one of my favorites.    Friendly staff and a good pie.
author: The-Pizza-Nazi S.

description:
Let's get this out of the way: this is not great pizza, but it's decent and they're open until 3 am which makes it the best post-game drunchies in the area. 

Best slice: Chicken & Pesto + liberal application of parmesan, garlic, red pepper flakes, and oregono

The cheesesteak was also surprisingly good
author: Eleazar V.

description: What you'd expect from a place like Pronto pizza. Not that amazing but eatable for sure. The pricing was good at best for a place like that in SF.
author: Augusto G.

description: The best pizza ever I have ever tried. Good service and good pizza. I ate one cheese slice. It just was a tasty and fresh. Great experience.
author: Firas A.

description:
My wife and I  ordered Pizza to go, the next day we had extremely sharp pain in stoma and Diarrhea all day long for 2 day, due to expired items they used! 

We may have to go to hospital, we had toxication 

Terrible feeling, Will never order food from here again!
author: Dream B.

description: We place out delivery order at 12am and we were told it would be delivered by 1am. We had our food in about 20min. Food was great and they even brought cups and plates without us asking. We ordered through grub hub but I wish we would have looked on yelp first as a warning did come up for poor food safety  we did not get sick but next time we will definitely check yelp first!
author: Autumn W.

description: Pretty funny that this place is called PRONTO pizza.  That's the one thing they can't get right.  I live 10 blocks from them and they usually take about 2 hrs to deliver.  I've ordered from them 3 times and every time is waiting 2 hrs for cold pizza
author: Daniel H.

description:
I think I'm addicted. 
I randomly stumbled upon this place doing a google search late night one time. Delivery was fast and hot. I had some that night and ended up finishing the Large veggie the next day for lunch and dinner. LOV Now I stop by every now and then after work for a slice or appetizers and they never disappoint.
author: Moaath S.

description: I ordered some cheese stick, not only were they delicious, the delivery man came early and he had a big smile on his face and left me with a good impression, i will definitely be coming back.
author: Victoria H.

description: Im recently moved to this place and when im looking for a pizza place!! I have suggested this place by my friend who has been here for more than 3 years. Firstly i thought to give a try but now im really addicted to pronto!! I love pizza here, the best thing about there pizza is the crust its just amazing. They usually take 45 mins for delivery which is not the best but reasonably good!! Im Really happy i found this place where i can get a hot pizza with nice quantity of toppings for not more than 20$ and all night till 3 am which is just awesome!!! Loved this place!! Guys if you want pizza for 20$ give a try im sure this place is worthful!!
author: Dinesh R.

description: Ok I don't understand my pizza is raw.. I came in and orders a slice and next thing you know it was done in 4min so I was all like damn that was fast thanks.. I realized it was still raw... so just because you saw me come in with a six pack doesn't mean I'm stupid or disoriented. So when I went home it was still raw. This is nasty and I'm not going to risk my health and get sick again. This not the first time that happened. Too bad I think it's the new people working there fault.
author: Anthony G.

description: The best pizza in town , I went there for dinner with friends and we order a pizza , the service was the best , nice , friendly and very welcome . Had the pizza after a short time of wait it for we amazing very fresh vegetables cooked with attention . Deserve more than 5 stars :))
author: Rahim B.

description: It was awesome to get a mushroom and chicken spaghetti in pronto pizza . I did like the food and the service. Thanks pronto pizza
author: Mohamed B.

description: Last night i went to this pizza store...i orderd chicken pesto pizza and wings and salad ...those are very spicy and good ..this is a best pizza store i ever had pizza.
author: Prasanth C.

description: friendly service, these guys are cool. I like this place for pizza by the slice! it's extra crispy...just the way it should be
author: Paul D.

description:
Judging by the pizza alone this place would be a 2 star. The pizza was pretty meh. My friend got a slice n i wasnt impressed. Im sure you can find way better.

Luckily for them, I tried the philly cheese steak sandwich, which is actually not bad. Its pretty cheesy and has good amounts of steak. Itll run you for bout 8 bux, which is actually not bad considering the size of the thing. It was bout a footlong so i saved the other half for later.

The place is open late night so thats kind of a plus.
author: Frank L.

description:
1St time and last time i make an order from here
Pizza was cold.
wings were burnt.
Made two orders of salads and only got 1
On top of all that they took more than 1hour to deliver.
author: Blanca H.

description: Great late night joint! Open til 3am. One of my favorite neighborhood places. Cheap yummy pizza! They offer more than pizza; pastas, salads and sandwiches too. The staff is very nice, friendly and always provide great service. The food is prepared quickly and my pizza is always piping hot.
author: Lynsey S.

description:
I was in town for the weekend with my daughters girl scout troop. We located your pizzeria in the phone book. We placed an order around 830 p.m. for delivery to the Hilton Union Square Hotel. We ordered 1 extra large cheese pizza, and 1 extra large pepperoni pizza, told eta would be 40 mins. We asked if they could provide us paper plates for 14 people, and they said they would. 

930 p.m. comes & our pizza arrives ... unfortunately, they got our order wrong !! The delivery guy shows up with 1 extra large half cheese, half pepperoni pizza. We asked him where the other pizza was, and he said he told his boss he needed 2 extra large pizzas, and his boss said no, they only wanted 1 half and half, so he showed up with one. He didn't bring the plates as promised. The delivery guy offered to bring us another extra large ALL cheese pizza, eta would be 40 mins. We said ok fine.

1030 p.m. delivery guy returns ... with 6 paper plates, and a lukewarm half cheese, half pepperoni pizza ... which was once again ... WRONG !!! And what is even more fucked up ... we were still charged for the pizzas .... and with that being said, my friend didn't tip the guy, since the service took forever, and our pizzas were wrong and almost cold. 

I will never order from this place when I am in the bay. Pizza was all doughy, sauce had no flavor. Kids were starving, so they ate it no problem, but the adults only ate one slice, and we gave the rest to the homeless outside the hotel.
author: Sexy Lioness F.

description: For a New Yorker this is as best as it can get as long you order just the plain ol' cheese topping. Their other menu items are not to be ignored. Don't let the fact that it is run by a Mexican staff, you will get an authentic Italian meal. Also, good delivery service.
author: Jerry M.

description:
Big hole in a wall kinda place. Not the best locale but if you're looking for cheap and good food, you won't go wrong with Pronto! I had the pizza sub with fries and a can of soda for $8.40 after tax. I was amazed with how delicious the sub was - 10" french roll with pepperoni, salami, pizza sauce, and a generous helping of shredded parma cheese. Great for a quick lunch and great value!

Of course during my 20 minute dining experience I saw many undesireable locals with one "harassing" me as I'm eating. But hey it's the 'Loin!!! You can't get that kind of experience anymore else in the city! HAHAHA...

Warning: staff can be a bit crass (probably of all the sh!t they go through being in that area), but it has that NYC-attitude vibe... just go with it!
author: Stephen Y.

description: Great customer service, great food, and awesome groupon deal! The owner was very personable... Highly recommend it!
author: Daisy S.

description:
Hole-in-wall pizza and sandwiches for your after party hunger pangs, close to Bill Graham.

Everyone in our group agreed that the pizza tasted like the frozen individual pizzas.  Not too much flavor, crust tastes stale, but it satisfies.  

If you're not feeling pizza, the Philly Cheese Steak is a good alternative because it's also melty and they toast the bread,... or the entire thing actually.

Being a pretty busy night when we went, food came out fast.  The friendly order taker quoted me 12 minutes and it felt less than that.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Not bad - but not so good either. It is the same price as several really good pizza bakers a few blocks away. 

The crust was a little too cracker like and the sauce was almost non-existent. The cheese was good, but not enough of it. Also the sauce was sparse in quantity and flavor.
author: MrandMs Squirrel S.

description: I really enjoy their pizza, and the salmon burger was delicious, very tasty and well served. I Also had a very good experince with their costumer service, the guys who work there are very nice and went an extra mile to please my friends and I. Good job with the upgrade of the pizza place, its very colorful and more spacious. I will come back to try the chicken sandwich next time!
author: Rocsana R.

description: They take over an hour to deliver and then they give us burned pizza. Really not acceptable. I would never order from them again.
author: Alisha K.

description:
This is a place that I go when I with my man. It's just walking distance and it's the only place that's open. 

It's is nothing the brag about in here, it's just a place where you can get a fat slice a n d it's open till 3am. 

But the food is okay,  they try to be courtesy but that comes with training.  No smiles just "Here, here's your pizza". They are probably surviving because they are open till very late. But I wouldn't he running here fron anywhere.
author: Angela F.

description:
Take the "L" out of Lover and it's OVER!  Pronto, you did me wrong for the last time!!!
I ordered a pizza online, said I would pick up, pay with cash and in the special comments wrote, "I live across the street, call me when it's ready". I set the alarm on my phone for 20 minutes. Never received a call, walked over to Prontos, didn't see my pie on top of the oven and knew we had a problem. The guy at the counter said there was not a pick up order,the guy making the Pizza had one order in front of him, he agreed. I said I know there's an order I have an email, that's when counter guy checked and found my order. "We'll have it for you in 15 minutes" counter guy said. I replied, "You should already have it ready from 20+ minutes ago"!! I walked out, around the corner and had a subway sandwich. 

Not sure what the problem is at Pronto, maybe they need to rig their take out order machine with an alarm so when they get an order they are aware of it,  twice now they have not made my order! Guess I should have followed my own advice and called to make sure they got the order but instead I think I'll just take my hard earned money elsewhere. Pronto's loss is  another establishments gain.
author: David P.

description: I am usually very skeptical when someone says there's good pizza in SF but this place did come highly recommended from a friend that also lived 10+ years on the east coast so we gave it a try.
author: Shekar R.

description: I was reading the reviews before I decided to order from her, I'll tell you guys something.. some people just write for fun or they might be drunk sometimes and some others are reasonable but the point is you have to try when you wanna get to know some places anyways I called this place to try there pizzas and pastas I got a thin crust pronto and a fettuccini seafood  yaaammy it was really really delicious and the delivery time was about 30 mnts...
author: Benjamin Y.

description: Really good grekko pizza I ate in like 2 seconds. Helped me kick my fever I got in china town. (Yuck gettin sick on my vacay)
author: Brian N.

description:
I saw a dinner special, and when it came time to pay, they would not honor it.
It is wrong to offer a special, and fail to display restrictions. I'm sorry to say the food was almost as bad as the poor customer service.
author: Geoffrey N.

description:
Spaghetti and meatballs tastes like fish.  Really guys, with marinara and noodles this bad it's a chore to choke it down.  I have a hard time throwing money away so I'm slogging through it but I'm giving myself permission to not eat more than half.  It is absolutely awful.  The pizza is worth three stars for the price but man is everything else nasty.  would do 2.5 stars over-all but as that is not an option I'll keep the charitable half star to myself.  Maybe I won't eat anymore after all.  Corn flakes is looking a lot better than fishy noodles.

Changed to 1 star after my stomach rebelled and i tossed my cookies.  Don't do it Casper!  You can get sick for free!
author: Seth C.

description:
Tonight was feeling badly (tooth sensitivity) but was hungry as hell ... thought of Pronto Pizza and their meatball and mozzarella cheese foot long sandwich but was afraid of tooth ouch so asked the cook to throw extra sauce on the sandwich.  That was the trick.  

Later called back to ask them to put extra dressing for my onion rings and the cook said "ok".  A few minutes later, the nice and handsome owner called me back and said "did you order onion rings" and I said "no" but my voice must have wished for onion rings.  LO AND BEHOLD, he comped me an order of onion rings cooked just right so they would not ouch my tooth.  What a great act of kindness in my stressed moment.

Pronto Pizza also makes the best sausage slices in town that are so generous in size.  One great thing is that they are open 365 days a year until 3 AM for you drinking peeps just getting home from 'last call'.

Again a great place to order food to be delivered, taken out, or eaten in.
author: Tamara C.

description: Super fast! Great pizza & at a great price! We all know how expensive pizza can be... So its nice to find a yummy pizza at a reasonable price! Check it out if your ever in the TL.
author: Layla L.

description:
Pizza was acceptable... once they got the order correct.

On 1/22/16, I ordered a hawaiian pizza on thick crust. A very simple order. What they delivered had sausage, pineapple, jalapeños all on a burnt thin crust.

The people there don't have a strong command of english as I was transferred from one person to another when I called them to have them fix it. I had re-state the problem and the correct order multiple times.

The order was made on line so there shouldn't have been any confusion on the order but somehow they managed to mess that up.

When they made moves to correct the order they didn't even offer anything in compensation for the additional time in delivery and the whole inconvenience.

I emailed the internet service they use... mypizza.com but they have done nothing yet.
author: Alex P.

description: This serves as a great pit stop slice joint and delivery place. Most of the business is through phone orders and delivered out, but I like stopping in for a slice for a movie as well. The slices are relatively fresh and they'll make what you want in a matter of minutes if it's not on display. The cheese is oozy and drizzled from the looks of it, though lots of pizza grease floating on top. This is one of those you will probably blot. There's a good lunch slice deal that includes a side salad and drink. The service is incredibly friendly. As with all pizza places, be sure to check out their website for deals!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Slices, 'spresso and sandwiches.

Pizza was OK. Two bucks and change  for an already made, warmed up and decently sized slice of cheese. No better or worse than many other places.

Coffee was better. Small and extremely potent Americano for just two bucks. Surprisingly smooth even without syrup. Bottles you see are just for show.

Sandwich was the best. Outstanding $7.50 combo of grilled chicken, marinara sauce and Parmesan cheese on a 10" wheat roll. Big enough for two. Or one when it's this good.

Friendly staff will gladly make you one pronto.
author: Jason B.

description: Came here for a slice and a Caesar salad and both were solid! Floppy cheesy greasy oversized slice (just how I like it), and yummy salad with lots of Parmesan and croutons. I live near here and will come back for sure; however, draws a sketchy clientele as hang out spot at times.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Pronto Pizza is a neighborhood staple. They have a variety of menu items and they are all tasty. I will admit, this place is not phenomenal, but it covers all the basis. 
The sell pizza by the slice or pie, ready to take away or made to order and heated up in their oven. Their mozzarella sticks and marinara are awesome. The sandwiches and burgers are tasty. When I first moved into the neighborhood, I had their chicken caesar salad every day - fantastic.
The decor is simple, diner style. It's frequented by the taxi drivers and that keeps it safe not seedy. They show soccer games on TV and Giants/49ers when their on - yay! The staff is polite and efficient.
This place is open all day and after last call, and they get busy with the after drinking crowd on the weekend. You won't wait too long though.
author: Dusty S.

description:
Steph and I went out to grab some pizza while we were waiting for our old professor to karaoke... Yeah... We get into some crazy adventures. 

I have gone here before... I think. It's all hazy. But I remember I liked it. 

And I liked it this time around too. Compared to that really shitty pizza place up the street from me, this place ruled!  

If you're stuck in the library (me) and all you want is carbs and cheese  and pesto (also me) and you don't want to pay for Escape from NY (not me.) (Ok, me.) (And most of my friends!) I recommend you come here.
author: Emily D.

description:
I don't know why the overall rating isn't that high. In my opinion, this is some of the best "fast food" pizza in the city! I might even stretch it & say it's close to Arinell's in quality.

Friday late night, stopped in for a slice of cheese & veggie. The servings are large. $2.70 for cheese & $3.something for others. $6.30 for 2 slices. The bottom was cooked to a beautiful doneness - crispy but not burned. The cheese was melted nicely & evenly & the veggies covering the slice were very generous. I live close by & had been wanting to try this place. Even had enough for leftovers the next day. Took a few bites when it was cold & the taste was still good then when I heated it up (30 sec in microwave then broiler on low for a few minutes to make it seem like it's fresh) it was just as good as the night before. 

Others there were eating sandwiches but I think I'll stick to the pizza. They also have salads & pastas. 

Friendly guys. He answered my questions honestly (is your pesto fresh? do you make it in house? the answer: not made in house. they used to but it got too expensive) & provided fast & friendly customer service. I won't be surprised if I "accidentally" end up there again after a night out.
author: Marissa H.

description: I love the pizza here! It is my go to spot for a late night slice, after work or after partying! They are really friendly and open till like 4am! Also, taxi's hang out here at night so A- you can easily get a cab home after eating, and B- there are always people on the street so you wont get mugged!!! Win Win Win lol
author: Katelin N.

description: This is an okay place to grab some pizza.  It's good and hot.  As others have mentioned, just be careful late at night.
author: John F.

description: If you're not choosy or picky, you can order what's on their trays, then make a dash for it to home.  They're from another culture, so attitude needs to be put on the shelf somewhere.  Got to eat if hungry and let's say, no place to choose.  Some Walgreen worker across the street said they sell drugs here.  Who said that?  Identify yourself.  I'm here for either Hawaiian or Veggie.
author: BanBan B.

description: I'm heartbroken !  This was my favorite pizza place in SF but the last few deliveries have been cold or burnt or missing items or crushed.  Just to many other places that I can order from to put up with crappy food.  Pronto is off of my Fav list ; (  We had a good run but it's over now.
author: Jon S.

description: I've been eating here for 3 years, and I've probably gotten 1000+ chicken sandwiches. The pizza isn't great which is ironic but I will reassure you that the sandwiches are 10/10 and my family from all over always comes to eat their sandwiches! I will always be a regular and their sandwiches are exceptional and I highly recommend. The staff are also very nice, so don't let the location fool you.
author: Vanessa G.

description: I had their chicken & pesto pizza and it was great.  Whenever I am in the city this is a place I like to try for their food, Their chicken wings also are awesome.  The burger with fries too is nice. I noticed that they did an upgrade and some remodeling, it looks much nicer now. Thanks.
author: Vero P.

description: Cheap, late night eats. The pizza isn't the best, but the wings and mozzarella sticks are good. The Philly is good some days and not so good others.
author: Meg W.

description: Pizza was really good. The medium Hawaiian was like a large and delicious. However, I feel they use the same amount of dough for the medium as the large, they just roll it out more so the crust was pretty thin.  Delivered in under 45 minutes. Happy with this place!
author: Renee P.

description: I cannot believe how horrible this pizza is.  I ordered an xl Pronto combo pizza. Order arrives after an hour (fine). Pizza has maybe 2 tablespoons of cheese on the entire thing. I called Pronto and Nassir first said we had ordered "light cheese" (we didn't) then said it would take at least 20 minutes for him to get in touch with the manager to resolve the issue.  1.5 hours after the order they might begin to make our correct pizza. Unbelievable that employees are not empowered to correct mistakes on the spot.  I have ordered off-and-on from this place for 5 years. There is better pizza out there but this place has been good in a pinch. Never again.
author: Esembee B.

description: Ordered a delivery on Tuesday night.  The guy who answered the phone had a real hard time understanding English??? But they got the order right. Pizza was over cooked and cool. Won't go back and I would not recommend.  3 stars are cause they delivered it at 9:30. Even bad pizza is good when your hungry.
author: Tracy G.

description:
Ordered from here again.

I ordered the burger.  It was overcooked.  It probably would have been a good burger if it wasn't so well done.  It was a nice sized patty.  The bun was a nice sesame bun.  The other ingredients were fresh.

I also ordered their wings.  While these were not traditional wings, they were big, juicy, and pretty spicy.  I enjoyed them.

I ordered the calzone with pepperoni.  It was consistent with the one from my first review.  I enjoyed it very much.

Ordering easy via Grubhub.

Delivery was prompt, professional, and polite.

Free 2 liter soda or 1.5 liter water with orders over $20.
author: Mark D.

description: Is it the best pizza I have ever had? Well No but it's pretty good.  The hours and parking are good and the employees are nice. Good prices . They stay open very late . The pepperoni is really greased up. It will slide right out of you. I like the sausage pizza and the subs are pretty good.  Take the food to go if you can . Prices are good to . I just like this place for some reason.
author: Tim S.

description: Much of the meat here is halal. Pro-tip- you can ask them to "press" any of there sandwiches to turn them into paninis.
author: Ammar R.

description:
This place is the furthest thing from 'pronto' i have ever experienced.

we ordered burgers...they took for fucking ever to get to us...i would joke and say that perhaps they had to go out back and butcher the cow...but the meat was far from fresh and i suspect it wasn't even cow!

Jesus Christ guys!  Hurry the fuck up!
author: Ripley B.

description:
Not so pronto.

After ordering on seamless, they called me 40 minutes after i placed my order later saying my order didnt meet their minimum although they had a different value set in seamless. Dont know how the food is but their service is terrible.
author: Evan K.

description:
The pizza here was pretty good. I ordered large 2 topping pizza and mozzarella sticks. The cheese sticks were pretty good, would have been better fresh I'm sure. The pizza took about 40 minutes to be delivered and we live a few blocks away, so not sure if that is normal for pizza delivery. Anyway, we enjoyed the pizza with extra to spare for the next day and it was still yummy. We will be ordering from here again.

**Had to downgrade the stars from 4 to 3. Due to hit and miss from pizza quality**

The first time the pizza was really good! The second time, the pizza was mediocre at best and left us wondering wth happened? Again the pizza took about 40+ minutes to get to us. I still love the cheese sticks though and can imagine how delicious they would be if fresh.
author: Lisa L.

description:
First time ordering takeout, and I was impressed. First off, I had coupon to use but was placing an online order, and they honored it. Didn't order anything fancy, just a plain cheese Thin crust pizza and a veg. sub. Both were done perfectly. The pizza was very very tasty (good/appropriate amount of cheese) and made thin (the slice could be folded as it should be ... as thin as Escape from NY pizza and other more popular thin crust locations). Asking for thin crust from other local/nearby areas doesn't get you a true thin crust that tastes good. -- Here, they did the pizza perfectly, per my request. And, the sub was very tasty as well and made extra spicy. 

Everything was done perfectly. Rafe (Rafael) was excellent with making this a great first-time experience and I will be ordering regularly.
author: M s.

description:
Yum! Pizza! With Halal pepperoni and sausage(: Mmm.

Came here with my girls after our New Years Eve celebration looking for something tasty and satisying to heal us after a long night! Came here at around 2:30am and found the place packed! As we entered the place, people were leaving and we got a table in the middle. The floor was a bit sticky... but it's understandable since it was almost 3am. We bought a whole pizza with half chicken and the other half being sausage and canadian style bacon. YUMM, nomnom(: Definitely hit the spot! My other girlfriend bought the chicken sandwich which was real good from the big tasty bite that I had stuck my teeth into! Tasty. Def. a joint to try if you're craving something oily, cheesy, and tasty after a long night. 

Will be back if I'm in the mood for some grub (:
author: Shafeena H.

description:
Got the Green pizza, artichokes, garlic, and pesto. Mm, fresh, good and hot. I could really taste the garlic, it was freshly grated. 

The employees were really friendly.
author: Mandy D.

description: I went in for the first time but didn't get pizza actually. The sandwiches looked appetizing so I garabbed the Chicken sandwich. It was tasty and filling. The chicken wasn't dry either! The price was about 6-7$ but it was big. It's a great place for fast food I feel!
author: Lena T.

description: If you're looking for healthy food, go elsewhere.  That being said, this is a great place for a slice of pizza when you've got that insatiable craving for one.  I've come here for years, and today did not disappoint.   I got the special:  one-topping (very generous pieces of pepperoni) with a giant salad, that included very fresh greens, cucumbers, & tomatoes, and a small drink.  All for $4.98!  My companion got the same, with a Ceasar salad.  I added the olives and Parmesan shavings from that salad to mine.   Sooo delicious.  The pizza is just right; not too thin, & not overly doughy either.  It is indeed a hole-in-the-wall, but I love this place.  I've never gotten take-out or delivery, so I can't comment on that.  Yes, it's not in the best area, but hey...it is the tl.  My experiences have been great, overall.
author: Natalie C.

description: Wow. Worst pizza experience ever. No exaggeration. After driving 8 hours we arrived at our hotelat 10 and immediately ordered dinner. We simply ordered a thin crust pepperoni pizza and wings with blue cheese (even called back to confirm the blue cheese). We received a veggie supreme pizza and wings with no dressing. We call Prontos to ask what might have happened. They said they must have dropped off the wrong pie. Instead of making us a new pizza they call the driver and tell them to drop off the correct pizza. So 30 minutes after the original pizza was dropped off we receive the correct pizza. So now we're stuck eating pretty much cold pizza and cold wings and it's almost midnight. On top of it all the person on the phone hung up on my husband who was not being rude or negative. I'm seriously shocked by this lack of customer service plus the horrible food experience. I hope this review saves someone from their own horrible experience.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Dirty fingernails, dirty hands, touching pizza, throwing it in the oven, and making my change. 

Disgusting.

I didnt have the heart to tell him wtf, give me my $ back, i am out of here....

So i tossed the pizza to go in the trash.

I was passing thru and needed lunch so i stopped in.

What a freaking mistake.
The health department needs to visit the workers here.
author: Sf Momm Y.

description:
I ordered slice of chicken pesto and I liked it. Ordering pizza by the slice makes it so easier for individuals. I cant expect a very clean restaurant at tenderlion. But still I was disappointed with their rest room. It was horrible. The food department should have that fixed. How can I expect that employees have proper hygiene with the rest room. 

5 star for Pizza
-2 for awful rest room. 

I suggest this place for to go.
author: Hani A.

description: Had pizza for the first time in pronto it's tastes really good. toppings added to it are quite enough for the size of the slices.sandwiches too tastes great.I'm loving those pizzas
author: Santhosh Reddy K.

description:
I live a block away so I can't review the delivery, but I give them 3 stars for being open until 3am to help with late nights cravings.
Also the pizza is decent though nothing to rave about; same about their spaghetti meatballs.
Staff is pleasant enough if compared to the usual rudeness from other similar small pizza joints.
If I'm around and it's late, that's my go-to place, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Vithiet L.

description: First time I tried there pizza it was recommended by a neighbor it was okay at the time. So on 10/31 we needed to order something to eat it was about 1:00 a.m.. Pizza was all I could think of on the fly. Pronto is all I could remember being open late and close by. We were staying at a hotel for a special occasion. I made sure to tell the guy taking my order were I was staying at. We'll they delivered the pizza to my APT. not the hotel that I was staying at.  The pizza was cold and no diet soda as I asked. I threw the whole pizza away such a waste of money!  We went to bed hungry!!! Frozen pizza is better than what they make!
author: SP G.

description:
Cruising down Eddy on my 2 feet, mmm what's that I smell? Arabs making Pizza? must be halal meat!

Aside from the lovely lady boys selling themselves right around the corner, Pronto is the one place that is open for business @ 3:30am. On any given day, catch these guys working they're holy asses off, pizzas, sammies, what's this coffee too now? The whole shabang, call it: The Habeebee hustle. All I ever eat is that addicting chicken sammich, that thang is more bomb than the Arab who made it.
(shhh.. I can make this distasteful joke, because I know the owner).

"Wattup Saeed? How the kids? What, you're going to skin me for the sorry dog manure that I am? Why? It was a joke!"

$6.99 for my chicken sammie, throw in an ice cold Orangina, friendly words with the muslim buddies behind the counter, and promptly I am greeted by the dusk of dawn. Ladies boys still working? Holy moly!
author: Sani S.

description:
This pizza was better than what I can get out in the Sunset district late at night. They are open daily from 11 am to 3am.  I was glad I was with a group of friends because the location plus some of the clientele would make me nervous if I were alone. 

We had two veggie pies, ( the Greco and Sarah's favorite). I thought Sarah's favorite was grubbin. It was chicken, pesto, onions and roasted red peppers.  Some folks ordered some of the sandwiches. They also offer pasta dishes as well as appetizers like jalapeno poppers & hot wings. They do not sell any beer or wine. oh well we got our grub on and went back to drinking at a bar.
author: Infodiva B.

description: Took forever to get delivered (90 minutes). Decent pizza for a late night snack, but not anything over the top amazing.
author: Ryan R.

description:
GROSS, GROSS, GROSS!!!!!  I swear their pizzas in general are either idling around for days or made with ingredients donated from a food bank.  Or both!  

I stopped in for a quick lunch.  Ordered a slice of pizza to go.  No less than 10 minutes after chomping it down, I felt nauseated.  Their appetizers are gross too.  It tastes like something you'd buy frozen from Safeway that's riddled with sodium, preservatives, etc. and has been refrigerated for ages.  Did I mention bland?

The only nice element is their price.  You can get something for less than $5.  Then again, can you put a price tag on your stomach and taste buds?  If you have to return to work and/or have a meeting to attend, I wouldn't risk missing it by eating here.
author: Honest J.

description: Not fan! the location was around the Tendorloin, very trashy naiborhood. The picture of the guy I took feel over and was obviously mentally ill, it was cramped up and very load for being that late or early in the morning. The pizza all around was alright nothing special, but nothing worth mentioning.
author: Grant S.

description:
~~Rude, Late, and Unapologetically Bitter a.k.a. the 2-Hour Pizza~~

Avoid at all costs. 

I was promised delivery in 30 minutes and after 60 minutes I hadn't heard from them. No call, no text, no Instagram direct message. I called after the initial hour, but no answer. Ten minutes later they did pick up, but they didn't apologize for not picking up before. They did offer 15% off and said the order would be delivered within five minutes. Twenty minutes later I had no pizza, so I called again. Still no apology.

I felt bad for the delivery guy who finally showed his sheepish face nearly two hours after I placed the order, completely ignorant to the whole situation. He asked for the full price, so I called the manager again. "Are you prepared to make things right?" I asked. 

He was profane, stubborn, and gave Christian Bale's leaked Terminator tirade a run for its money.
author: Bradley T.

description:
I rarely crave for pizza. And when I do, I don't want no healthy, good-for-you pizza. I want the works!! A fat slab of cheese oozing, topping overflowing, oil dripping piping hot goodness. 

Pronto definitely hit the spot. My-oh-my!

7 minutes for my slice, only because it was busy. But definitely worth the wait. They have premade cheese pizzas and as you order your slice, they load on your toppings and pop it back into the oven. The result? Tongue burning slice of Greco (pesto, olive & feta cheese) with a crispy crust. MmmmMmmmm. I was a very happy girl.

Great lunch deals too! Will definitely go back!
author: Marti L.

description:
A little while ago we were trying to find an affordable pizza place that delivered for a big bulk order.

Pronto delivered. In quality, price, and literally. Tthey delivered a stack of delicious piping hot cheee pizas on time, with a smile.

The delivery guy - even high fived me and helped carry them in.

And the best part....

They only charged me a "special coupon discount price" of  $10.99 for each extra large pie.

Uh....I don't think Domino's can even match that (if they can...well you're basically paying for cheese covered cardboard)
author: Jessica T.

description:
Upsides: Really good burgers and fries, will deliver for $12 minimum.

Downsides: They don't follow your instructions when delivering (like "bring napkins"), they don't bring the food upstairs (I have to go get it), they've come with the wrong soda, they sometimes take longer than they say they will, and food has come cold.
author: Ryan S.

description:
best late night pizza place in this part of town (roundtable was closed so i couldnt order my ultimate veggie with white sauce). had some issues with the kid that took my order when I called; mainly that he didn't know anything about the place that he worked. I asked if I could get one of the coupons deals without the coupon since I was staying in a hotel and did not have printer access and was told no. then when i went to pick up my order (they have free delivery but i figured it would be quicker, easier, cheaper etc to pick it up myself) there was a menu with the same coupons I had seen online.

anyway, since i ordered a lot of stuff I tried to pay with a $100 bill and they could not break it. so, i had to use smaller bills. the pizza itself is average. toppings were great and the cheese was good, but the dough tasted generic. they sell pizzas by the slice too. so, if you're looking to fill up on the cheap this is a good place. otherwise, if you're looking for some more upscale try other people's recommendations on yelp.
they have small tables inside, but unless you're just eating a slice, I'd take it to go. the location is kind of depressing. 

the desert and coffee menu was laughable, so i wound up walking up the hill on van ness to the most Amazing (no embellishment) bakery. Van Ness Bakery & Cafet is 24 hours to boot. i doubt the cake slices were made on site, but everything else looked so delicious. ended up getting a fatty cookie and a fruit/chocolate parfait.
author: Drew T.

description:
Hits the spot.  

When I crave food, it's usually for a hunky slab of greasy, cheese-oozing, bubbly pizza. I was tempted to get an entire small pizza for myself since it's free delivery via grubhub.com for orders of $15 or more but I decided that I probably wouldn't be able to finish it all.  So I took a walk in store and ordered two slices, the chicken pesto and the hawaiian.  For the pesto, they just poured pesto sauce on top of the pizza, which I thought was a little weird but tasted alright.  I really wanted to try Sarah's favorite but they didn't have it listed on their board.  Actually, they didn't have any of the specialty pizzas listed in store.  I think it may be just an online thing, which sucks cuz I wanted to try them.  Note for those who want to try their specialities, order online.

The two slices were huge.  I was stuffed after eating one.  So I took my leftovers home.  They were warm and the bottom was crispy.. mMmMm~ Perfect combo.  The pizzas were delish and I was sober when I tried them.  While I cannot vouch for how they taste drunk or hungover, I can clearly say that the pizzas are delicious even while sober.  I bet they'd taste even more amazing at 2 in the morning.
author: Tori Q.

description:
i wouldnt order from these sons of goats if they fed the homeless for free every night......how many fliers do they think it is necessary to hang on your door handle, door knocker,gate post, walkway railings, trash can and garage door every time they PAPER a hood? seven pamphlets on one house means they are wretched pizzas because they have been called and inform bout all the paperhanging in an attempt to let them know...hey!!! maybe your leaflet people are screwing you by throwing them away even! you should check on it! to be met with a litany of curses...the ONE time I ate here it was horrible...chicken wings practically raw, then the replacement ones were BURNED, the crust was soggy and the chemical taste coming from the black olives..MEH!!!!
Napoli Pizza is MUCH MUCH better in this hood!
author: Chris D.

description: Yuck this place is nasty I now have heartburn and the people were very rude to me on the phone plus they don't know how to take directions horrible I will never order from this nasty place again
author: Someday You W.

description:
Is this gourmet? No...., but is it tasty?  Yes.  And do they deliver late? Yes!  Like 1:30 am late? Yes!

Once midnight hits, anything cheesy is tasty so by default, pizza in general will give you at least 2 stars unless it is totally crappy cardboard tasting pizza. Hey, even a $0.99 cents Mama Celeste pizza tastes better at 2 am rather than 2 pm! 

Pizza Pronto is 3.0  stars. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but at 1:30am + free delivery, it definitely fills the belly if you know what I mean. $29 total for large 3-topping deep dish pizza, 6 pcs mozzarella sticks, and a 2 liter soda. 

But the $3 extra for deep dish was weird.  I don't mind the price, but apparently "deep dish" means a thin cheese-stuffed crust? Huh? How about calling it "cheese stuffed crust" instead???  Overall, the toppings and non-crust part of the pizza tasted pretty good, but the crust reminded me of a cheap pizza. But then again, I only tried Pizza Pronto because of those dangly fliers they rubber-banded to my front door.....

All in all, pizza was okay and better than most, and I do give them an extra star for fast and free delivery service late at night (1:30 am). Yeah, nite-owls are the best!
author: Colleen L.

description:
I order out from here, but they are pretty great. I accidentally ordered a cheese-filled crust on a calzone (doh!)

They called to fix the order right away and even threw in a freebie to compensate.  These folks are awesome!
author: Tyler D.

description:
Come here after midnight and you will most likely see large groups in dressy attire usually fresh from a club or lounge. 

Like one of my favorite taquerias, this place has always been related with alcohol. Maybe because its open till 3 in the morning and its the closest thing between Union Square and Nob Hill that's open and halfway decent.

I can't recall the last time I've been here sober - haha! So I cannot say for sure how good the pizza tastes - since almost anything tastes great when your a bit tipsy! I do love the veggie pesto with garlic.

Overall - its not pricey, the garlic bread is great, and they are usually pretty quick even during late night when they get busy.
author: Alex C.

description: Decent cheese pizza slice. Good value at only $2.50 which included tax, for a large slice. Service was efficient, not really friendly but ok.
author: Karen J.

description: This spot has some great affordable pizzas. Delivery for anything over $12 makes late night eats an option. They're on seamless so we order from here on the regular.
author: Chris S.

description: My after a long night of drinking this is my go to neighborhood pizza joint. Pizza is ok but at 1:30am its pretty darn good. Nice size slice for the price. Sometimes they forget to put toppings on your slice so take a look at your order before you leave if getting to go.
author: Linda L.

description: I've been a loyal customer of this place for at least 5 years ordering pizza and apps for delivery at least twice a month.  I'm now officially done and it's all based on their repeated delivery incompetence.  Two weeks ago I waited 3 hours and had to make 3 calls to follow up on my order (a small pizza and some mozzarella sticks) .  I was repeatedly told it was on the way.  I told them just to cancel the whole thing and not charge my card, but they wouldn't.  When it did show up, it was cold.  The manager actually called me to apologize and said the next order would be on him.  So I tried again last weekend and 90 minutes later only have my order arrived (a small pizza).  The guy said he'd go straight back, get the mozzarella sticks and soda and be back in 15 minutes.  It took an hour.  To add insult to injury,  the pizza was wrong.  Wrong kind of crust and not all the toppings I paid for were there.  Checked my account today, and I was charged... they didn't comp anything.  Prior to this I received hit or miss service over the years.  Sometimes the food was fast, hot, and good.  Other times it was a mess (undercooked/raw dough).  No consistency.  Order for delivery at your own risk.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I ordered a pizza online from them at about 9:15pm. I called at 10:30pm when I was still pizzaless and questioning my knowledge of the word Pronto. Something was relayed to me about us probably being one of the problem orders today. I was told they would take full responsibility, though I'm not reallysure what that means to them, because I didn't hear about them discounting my pizza or really doing anything to correct their mistake. I guess it was just an admission that they were at fault? Oh, thanks, I wasn't really clear about that, but now that you've told me, I can clearly see it was your fault. 

Pizza arrived about 11:20. 20% off?

I translated Pronto from Italian to English on Google translate, and was surprised to find quite a few adjectives. #6 being - game. As in, "You got played motherfucker!"

Thanks Pronto. I will look forward to being hungry and pizzaless again in the near future. And I will accept that it is your fault. Just to be clear.
author: Ken L.

description:
Their pizza isn't the best, unless you enjoy gobs of grease smothering a paper-thin crust. I like thick-crust pizza, but maybe that's just me. However, if you're staggering around this neighborhood after a night at the bars, this place definitely isn't a bad idea.

Service is terrible. Pronto is very New-York-esque in that the employees would never even consider engaging in conversation beyond, "What do you want?" and, "$10.33". A few times they've screwed up my order and left me standing twenty minutes for a slice. Of course, they didn't apologize, they just quickly handed it to me in a greasy box and turned around as quickly as possible to avoid any complaints or uproar.

The reason I return to this place constantly is mostly because it's across the street, but also because they have good sandwiches and wings. Their calzones aren't bad, either, but you have to wait for them. Sometimes the speed of service can really be outstanding, but other times it is abysmal. It's never anything in between, it's either a really great or really terrible experience, so I'm leaving this review at three stars.
author: Eliot R.

description:
A friend and I hit this place up after a long night of partying it up at KMR. 

You cannot beat fresh pesto pizza at two o'clock in the morning.  It was packed, too!!!  The wait for my order was a little longer than expected, but it did not matter because I was intoxicated and had fun observing all of the drunk people eat their pizza.  

The prices were reasonable, too!
author: Pelon P.

description:
Really 3.5 stars...

Despite moving to the left coast from NYC about a year and a half ago, I'm still having trouble adjusting to the pizza out here and at one point must learn to accept that it's just different.  Regardless, I must stick to my philosophy that any pizza is better than no pizza at all.

Last night I was struck by a massive craving for Round Table's Gourmet Veggie pizza but could not bring myself to pay the astronomical price for a teeny tiny pizza - enter Pronto Pizza.  After checking out the veg options from many other pizza joints in the area, I settled on the Spinacio pizza from Pronto; it includes spinach, olives, red onion, fresh tomatoes, and feta with red sauce, rejoice!  Believe it or not, it's hard to find veg pizza options other than the standard without green peppers and with red sauce.  

The quality of the pizza was decent, not overly cheesy and greasy as some have expressed here.  The price was very reasonable and they delivered in less than 45 minutes.  I'm sold.
author: Laura C.

description:
It's late at night and my friends and I have arrived at my apartment after a long and tiring concert. We're starving and are way too lazy to leave my place. We decided to try Pronto for their late-night delivery. Didn't get the pizza though - we were all craving for cheeseburgers.

We ordered off of eat24hours.com. There was this deal where we could get free garlic bread or salad. I think there were other choices, too. 4 of my friends ordered their cheeseburgers medium, and 2 of us ordered ours medium-rare.

Burgers were okay. Fries were surprisingly really good! We opted for free garlic bread but they gave us the salad instead! We were pretty disappointed about that... Our burgers weren't marked either, so we didn't know which ones were medium and which ones were medium rare.

Overall, it was okayyyy. Definitely gonna try their pizza one time. I didn't expect their burgers to be amazing or anything, since they are a pizzeria.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I'm pretty picky about my pizza, being from the east coast, where pizza is an art form.

Pronto is pretty good.  It's mostly NY-style thin crust.  Crust is ever so slightly crispy (not soggy), cheese is great, and it's the right amount of greasy (slightly, but not dripping like mad).  The sauce was good, but not great, hence the slightly lower rating.  It's a shame, because the sauce is the most important part.

I had a slice of cheese pizza ($2.30).  You really can tell a lot about a pizza place by their plain ol' unadulterated cheese pizza.

Extra bonus: they're open until 3am every night, and are 2 blocks from my apartment.
author: Brian T.

description:
Good.

Price:  Reasonable
Portions:  Generous
Quality:  Thin greasy NY style pizza
Service:  Excellent

  This is a good quality pizza place.  Their NY style thin pie is excellent.  I had the slices that were reheated and they hit just the right spot.  Plus, the guys behind the counter are quite nice and friendly.  The best part is that this place costs quite a bit less than other "NY Style" pizza places.  I recommend it.
author: Dan A.

description: Good pizza and open late. However, the staff frequently keep change and overcharge drunk people, which is unconscionable.
author: Ned D.

description: Not a fan ! I remember my friend and I order pizza from here on halloween at 2am and they didn't deliver till almost 5am....pronto pizza isn't pranto!!lol just saying
author: Cindy Z.

description: They forgot our order and were rude when I called them about. Don't order unless you like being disappointed...they charge you for thing you don't get..
author: Liz P.

description: Got a seafood pizza that was very average. Seafood was pretty low quality; I am guessing canned clams and frozen baby shrimps. Crust was actually the best part of the pizza with perfect thickness. Delivery is quite slow too. Prices are good with coupons.
author: Ed L.

description: Pizza was over an hour and a half late and it wasn't even good. The pronto pizza was tasteless. The one with the ranch sauce was okay.
author: Irina M.

description:
So I have to start my review off on how we even heard of this place. 

After a long night of dancin' our asses off in the club, my room mate and I were looking for a place to get some grub in the wee hours of the morning. 

As we were walking back to our car my room mate had pop a squat (this means take a piss). She apparently found one of their door flyer's on the person's house that she was peeing in front of (hey, a girl's gotta go sometimes, don't hate). 

We called them up once we got back to our car. With me being drunk and the guy on the phone not being able to hear or understand me, because of the noise around him, it made for a pretty interesting conversation. Finally we got our order through. 

$20 bucks for a large pizza with toppings is a pretty good deal. But I am a pizza lover and this just didn't do it for me. The chicken they used was gross but the rest of the pizza was eh. OK. 

I do give them props for being open so late. We may end of venturing back here some day.
author: Danielle K.

description:
I'm a fan of their PIZZA & Jalapeno Poppers!  My delivery order came and the slices were thick and juicy!  Also to my surprise there was cheese in the crust!  AWESOME!

Of course this delivery was at 3:18 a.m.  So to have food delivered to you at that time when you have this craving is awesome too!!!!!!

THANKS!
author: Limzer L.

description:
I looked him straight in his eyes.

"You guys have the best pizza!"
He was confused, but I didn't care.

"One slice of the Hawaiian."

Located in the seedy tenderloin, it is easy to bypass Pronto Pizza.  The lack luster exterior simply did not scream pizza king.

For those from the suburbs, your pizza excursion includes an adventurous outing.

Grab a slice, hi-five Stacey the tranny, head over to an "Oriental Message" parlor.  All in a days work.

 While working at California Culinary Academy just a few blocks down, I can still recall my cubicle monkey days.  We had a "meeting just to set another meetings."  

Each meeting we had Pronto Pizza, I ate at least four slices and that was the birth of my sake belly. 

back to the present.

Caressing my Hawaiian pizza slice ($3.25) , the features still remain.  No greasy residue, but instead, a dry crispy thin crust.

The savory ham slices balance so ever well with sweet pineapple.  The cheese adds a nutty note.  

One bite, I had reached comfort food heaven.

Tip: Pizza taste better straight out of the oven.  Pizza delivered in cardboard box adds moisture from the heat making the crust soggy. Ask the pizza restaurant to cut a small hole (slither) as a vent.

I posted a photo on my blog.
author: Rayfil W.

description:
It said "Pronto Pizza & Espresso" on the menu flyer rubber-banded to my building's heavy metal door, but I snatched the flyer anyway.  Pizza AND Espresso?  Who thought up that combo? 

Anyhow, that was only the first thing to make me nervous about ordering from here.  I get suspicious whenever a pizza place also does burgers (Pronto does).  Or espresso, for that matter.   "Do one thing and do it well" is my pizza philosophy.

But I was craving pizza and this was the only coupon I could dig up.  I figured I'd check its reviews and decide from there.  And that's when I read Amanda S's favorable 4-star review...she weighed in the pros and cons and convinced me it was worth a shot.  Also, she mentions cute Brazilian delivery boys.  SOLD!

I was even more unsettled at having to repeat everything to the man taking my order because of how noisy it was in the background.  I read him my credit card numbers and hoped he heard me when I asked to have the driver call me upon arrival since our doorbell is out of commission.  I thanked him when he quoted 30-35 minutes, hung up, and held my breath.

...

Score!  The pizza arrived in just 25 minutes, was warm and tasty (not the best pizza ever, but for cheap pizza it did just fine), and the garlic bread was spongy and yummy.  My expectations, low as they were, were greatly exceeded.  And yes, the delivery boy was perilously close to becoming an extra topping--cute indeed!
author: Eric E.

description:
Not the best pizza I've ever had, but not the worst.  The little pizza shop isn't in the best part of town so you get all types coming in.  If you eat there, you'll be sitting next to some people who are waiting for their to go orders.  I just think that's awkward... but maybe I was just uncomfortable because I was sitting by myself and there were two guys sitting next to me and I could feel them staring at me eating.

The service is fast and the guy behind the counter is very nice.  Not sure if I'll be back, but it was worth the try since I was walking by and it was lunch time.
author: Maria L.

description: FOOD POISONING. Ordered the chicken tenders and a burger. The chicken tenders looked great and were crispy so I saved them for leftovers and ate the burger. Within a few hours I had horrible food poisoning that had me laid out for two days and caused me to miss my family's Easter party. Needless to say I tossed the chicken since I didn't trust anything from that place after getting sick.
author: g m.

description:
I love pizza.  I also stay up late.  When I forget to eat until after 3 a.m., I have to resort to Mr. Pizzaman.  When I forget to eat until midnight or so, I have many options.  But when I forget to eat until around one, Pronto Pizza's my boy.

I used to really hate the pizza from this place.  Maybe it was just because I was sick of ordering from the same place, but once I laid off on the pizza delivery for a while and started ordering from here again, I found that I really liked it.

The sauce is just all right, but the ingredients are really fresh, and they deliver pretty quickly.

UPDATE:  7/5/08
==============

I'm dropping this place to three stars--and I might drop it down even further--because they keep screwing up my orders.  One or two times is annoying but understandable, but four straight orders?  And when you don't have the kind of soda that I asked for, please let me know beforehand; don't just show up at my door with a soda that I will never drink.

UPDATE:  12/14/08
==============

OK, I've had it with Pronto Pizza.  They've screwed up my orders so many times in a row now, it's as if they're trying to piss me off.  The last three times I've ordered, I've gotten the wrong thing, and the pizza has been runny and not very good.  No more.  Ever.
author: John S.

description:
Ah the good ole days of college.

You know, the part where you completely disregard your sense of being health conscious, sleeping regular hours, and....well, you get the picture.

What goes along with above things? That's right ladies and gentleman, delivery.

Now Pronto's offers on site dining, but I never actually partook, and preferred to just sit on my fat ass and push the phone buttons with my lazy sausage fingers instead. GOD DAMN I LOVE DELIVERY YAP.

When I started ordering from Pronto's, it was just pizza. The pizza, while not being the best I've ever had, was never bad, and always arrived faster than they told you it would over the phone. Not just a little faster either, they always told me 45 minutes, and it was rarely ever more than 20 minutes....that's like (insert math here) percent faster than what they said! FUCK YEAH.

Now here is what kept me loyal to Pronto's until the day I moved out of delivery distance. 3am or later delivery. THREE. A. M. When you're sitting at your computer at 2:30 in the morning, and you realize you're starving and need food, else you might actually strangle the nearest cute fuzzy aminal you can find, there aren't many options. Thankfully there's Pronto's. 

"Pronto's Pizza how can I help you?"

"I HAVE AN EMERGENCY, IT IS VERY LATE AND I NEED LASAGNA AT MY DOOR STAT."

"Can I get your phone number please?"

"YES IT'S 302 507-"

"Oh hey Zack! Sure thing man, it'll be there in about 45 minutes."

".........oh. Ok good...um, thanks!"

That's right, they knew me by name at the first 6 digits of my phone number. Can you SAY good service?! These guys are amazing!

Sure enough, in about 20 minutes, the phone rings, and there is not only a steaming hot portion of lasagna, but a box of cheesy garlic sticks and a two liter bottle of orange Fanta. I didn't even have to order it, they just knew that's what I was going to order.

With service like that, the quality doesn't even NEED to be as good as it was. 

Oh how I miss thee, Pronto's. :[

Seriously though folks, if you live in delivery distance, this place is legit, so I suggest you check it out.
author: Zack H.

description:
Say, "F my South Beach Diet" and just come here for a late night eat.

This was better than the pizza I tried in New York or maybe I was just hungry and drunk. Either way, it was good! They have free delivery, which is awesome. I should have just asked them to deliver it to my car. LOL.

I didn't think too much of this place since not many late night eats are all that great. Trusted my friends word and came here after Bambuddha Lounge (horrible spot).

3 drunk people + 1 large combo pizza & garlic bread = FAT heaven

FYI.. if you've never eaten here then grab the coupons they have laying around. It's a way better deal than ordering off the menu.
author: Ken N.

description:
Soo... originally I would give this place three stars. After reading all the reviews I was glad to know I wasn't the only one that was given just "ok" service. Then I realize...half the time I order from this place its a Friday or Saturday night and I'm sh*t faced at my apartment and my friends and I just want to stuff our faces at 2 am. Peak hours on a weekend.. smart thinking haha.

I ordered tonight at around 9 o clock. The guy said it would be about 30 mins. No problem. Got a call from downstairs 15 mins later. Nice! And my pizza was perfect. Not too greasy (one of my main problems when I order on the weekend.. it takes FOREVER and seems a bit soggy/greasy). My friend got fries (since when did they start serving burgers and fries?). It was good. We used one of the many coupons so we didn't pay like 16 bucks for our food. 

To be fair though I have never had them mess up an order. I'm surprised after reading all these reviews. I feel like a total fatty since I always get the same guy to deliver to my place and I'm way past smashed when I come down to get my food. haha. He forgives me. 

4 stars for good honest service. And for cute Brazilian delivery boys!
author: Amanda S.

description:
I had been craving wings for a while, so I found this place online and placed an order for delivery. I got half a dozen wings and a cheeseburger with fries. Worst food I've ever had in this city.

The wings were clearly frozen, pre-sauced "heat and eat." They were tiny, flavorless, and cold. So I moved on, hoping the burger would be better, but I found onlt disappointment. The bun was burnt from being toasted too long, the lettuce was brown and wilted, and the whole thing had no flavor, it might as well have been made of cardboard. OK, so maybe the fries would be my last chance for a decent lunch. Wrong again. Ice cold and completely undercooked.

Avoid this place at all costs!
author: Chip N.

description:
...Ordered the pizza about an hour and fifteen minutes ago. They told us thirty-five minutes. Hmmm.....

Update: Two hours later:
After blatantly lying to us about the status of the delivery ("he's downstairs right now..."), it finally showed up. The poor delivery boy was in earnest, and if you're reading, we want you to know that we believe you, buddy! ...but whomever is dealing with customer service needs to shape up. 

Pizza's good, but it would be better hot. And I'm not even gonna touch the irony of their name.
author: Sarah C.

description: They have a lot of good food, i always like the chicken sandwich, its good, their delivery is on time!! thanks.
author: John A.

description: Pizza here is great - it's been my go-to for years. But the delivery times suck and are getting slower - you'll be lucky to get anything inside an hour.
author: Stew M.

description:
You know that part in the scary movie when someone says "You don't want to go there...it's evil" but the person he's talking to, goes anyway just to die a horrible, horrible death.

Well you won't die but your appetite will. So all I'll say is "You don't want to go there", if you do then you're on your own.
author: Troy R.

description:
I am getting the impression that I am easy to please in the pizza department.  

Yeah, the delivery showed up 20 minutes late, yeah, there was a hair in my buddy's slice, yeah, they gave us the wrong pizza, and yeah they gave us the wrong drinks, but still 3 stars!

The vegetarian combo had beautiful slices of fresh tomato on top. The four cheese combo was just as good as it looked.  Hell, I even liked the BBQ chicken we weren't supposed to get as you could really taste the cilantro. ... And it arrived hot!  Nothing but happiness from all who partook of prontos.

Had there been no hair, 4 stars!
author: Hayley W.

description:
This place is not bad for a local pizza joint.  They sell by the slice for about 2 to 3 bucks.  Nothing spectacular, but not bad either.  If i'm feeling cheesy that day, I'll stop by this place and grab a slice.  
The guys here are always friendly and nice.  They heat up your pizza when you order it, so when I get back to the office, it's still nice and warm.  They do not go cheap on the cheese either.. yum!  When you don't really have high expectations, this place is the pizza place to go.  Seriously, for 2 bucks, where else are you gonna get lunch?
author: AhLin C.

description:
Exactly what I expected.

Update:  This pizza is sooooooo goood when reheated in the toaster oven til it is crispy.  I am in heaven!

I have run in here from the bus stop to negate the effects of my workout moments ago up the street at Crunch and was fully satisfied.  I expected a thin gooey slice and that is what I got.

Last night I went out on a limb and ordered delivery.  The salad was regular.   The pizza was thin and gooey.  And I got a can of soda.  All this for 15 bucks.  There was enough left over for lunch today and a slice tonight.  [let's not talk about the effects this will have on my body]
