My expectations weren't high and they were met.  I also discovered that they have online ordering with crazy online coupons.  So all of the above combined with easy ordering and prompt service earns this place 4 stars and my gym 68 more bucks.
author: Ian M.

description:
This place should be put out of their misery. I waited over an hour before my pizza arrived. Somehow (and very creepily) the pizza boy got into my building - our buzzer doesn't work, mind you. I don't care if someone let you in - that just weirds me out. So we open the box, and the toppings are only on one side of the pie and it looks like some dumper sat on the pizza because it was flat and smashed. Grease was oozing everywhere. The slices were cut unevenly - I'm not perfect, but fuck - a 1/2 inch slice? Are you kidding? 

But here's the best part: we ordered garlic bread with a coupon, and when I opened our second box, there were fries with ketchup. What the fuck? I ate a few anyways because I felt entitled to and was thinking about calling back to ask about my bread, thinking I could get more free food. Instead, pizza boy calls me back to ask if he could switch the fries for the bread. I was confused...was he really planning on giving the other customer the fries after I pawed through them? Did he really think that a person who orders junk food wouldn't touch the fries? Five minutes later, he's back. I hand him the fries, and he gives me the garlic cheese bread. Great business practices, Pronto.

Whatever, I want my bread, so I'm dipping away in the ranch and ripping into this guy when I feel some hair floss through the cracks of my teeth. Usually I'm not grossed out, but this was too much. I could feel the hair - it wasn't just that I found a hair hiding in the sauce. 

WORST PIZZA JOINT EVER. Slow, expensive, dirty, waaaack. Why are there so many awful pizza delivery places around here? They all have the similar menu, similar prices, similar service - did they all attend the same pizza seminar?
author: Brittany L.

description:
Ate here for lunch because the wait at the brunch place down the street was ridiculous.
The pizza was good, nice and greasy like it should be. Reasonable prices, and they had Dr.Pepper (it's weird how rare it is in most places here). I was in heaven.

I don't live near here, but I'd definitely stop by again if I ever found myself hungry in the area.
author: Frank M.

description:
Quick, cheesy, greasy and cheap---

Words to describe both the food at Pronto Pizza and the weird collection of men who sit outside at all hours.
author: Veronica G.

description:
I had a small pesto pizza, which was sooo good! I looove looove pesto! Yum! The pizza is thin, which i love and i heard their sammies are good too. :)

*Halal meats served, extra plus :)
author: Karen F.

description: I always walk by this place and I have always been curious so the other day, I decided to come in. I was really hungry and didn't have a lot of money on me so I just got a cheese slice. It was good. Nothing spectacular but it was good. It hit the spot and I was on my way. I would go back to try other things on their menu.
author: Mel P.

description: Yes it's thin and only $2.50 for a cheese slice...there's a but coming...here it is...but I really didn't like the sauce and the crust was just ok.
author: Jeff J.

description:
"How is pizza like sex?" someone asked me once when I was a teenager. "When it's good, it's really good. And when it's bad, it's still pretty good." 

At the time, I laughed and agreed. Not so much any more. 

The dough completely sucks, usually it doesn't even taste fully baked. The salads are even worse...A box of bad lettuce, with two huge tomato slices. I've been back a few times for slices, in hopes that it would improve or that past experiences were just flukes. Unfortunately, my persistence has been rewarded with the same crappy dough every time.

To be fair, this place is open really late, which can be convenient if you're an owl. And the dudes that work there are efficient enough, but I wouldn't recommend telling them the "how is pizza like sex" joke.
author: Chadwick M.

description: came here around 10:00 pm with 2 other people. we were just around the area and wanted some pizza and saw this place.  place looked trashy and I was reluctant to sit down and eat there. we ordered a large margherita pizza to eat there (even though I didt want to). pizza was just okay but was better then i thought it was gonna be.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
The outside looked sketchy to me- but hello, Tloin.  But inside is really cute.  Well, the menu up on the wall with all the colored chalk- or something that is supposed to look like colored chalk- is cute.  The tables are basic but I appreciated the flat-screen with CNN going (I knew the Big Dig was going down any day now such a bummer).

I went there for pasta actually but didn't want to pay $7 until I knew the place was good.  I ordered the $4.95 meatball sandwich instead and it was solid.  Not awesome but solid.  Ask for extra sauce b/c they go a little light on it.  And I love that it comes with some jalapenos.  

I'll check out their pasta at some point b/c overall I was impressed enough.  

And the guys there seem like very cool decent people.
author: Staci M.

description:
This place freakin' sucks!!!
Sure they're open late, but only if you want to deal with all the freaky-freaks, gang stars and hoodlum types right outside. My favorite thing about this place was leaving.
author: Chris B.

description:
Basically, pizza is pizza.

If you call them super drunk say after downing 7 vodka redbulls in an hour before the open bar mysteriosly closes, order the "largest stuffed crust you've got" with whatever toppings your fat ass desires and then get ready for the hilarity that shows up at your door step. It's obscene. 

I like Pronto Pizza. I mean, it's pizza, it's greasy, I'm not some paranoid New Yorker trying to cling to the super pizza best in the land crown of the universe or something. I had Pronto in NYC and Pronto in SF. I cant tell the difference. I can't tell the difference between Pizza Hut and Pepsi Cola most of the time.
author: Brian J.

description:
Delivery until 3 am. That right there is worth a couple of stars. I know these guys can be slow at times, but consider this - last night at 2:15 a.m. I just get home from the clubs (against my better judgment on a Monday evening) and I realize I am starving. Of course the only thing in the world that will satisfy you in that frame of mind is pizza. Also against my better judgment.

The pizza arrives as I recover from my stupor. It isn't just warm, its hot. Like hot enough to still burn the roof of your mouth. The crust is thin, the toppings are decent and at three a.m., it is delicious of course. Not sure how I feel about Pronto cold the next day though.

So far they have yet to mess anything up for me. Well, they did give me a 2-liter of Pepsi when I said Coke. I can forgive them that but my god, Pepsi? Yech. For my health's sake, I will probably try to refrain from ordering post-midnight pizzas, but if I just have to, it will probably be Pronto again. Apparently my better judgment sucks.
author: Zac H.

description:
This Review Pertains to Delivery Only. I've never been to the shop: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY.

I almost feel badly giving Pronto only one star. Almost. The pizza is generally good and they make the best wings I've ever had delivered. (Baked, brushed with spices and oil and are nice and crispy skin and juicy meat) and they deliver for free.

So how is it I can give them one star you ask? 

Like a few posters before me, I'm really not sure what happened. I used to look forward to my Pronto Pizza, but the past few times I've ordered, something major has been wrong... 

When I was first introduced to Pronto by my neighbors, it was when they had a guy standing in front of their door holding a fantastic smelling pizza that was obviously nice and fresh, as I could see the steam escaping from the box. Neat. Then I actually got to enjoy several similar deliveries of my own tasty pizza and/or wings. "Hooray" I thought. But it wasn't to last long...

Episode1: I now recognize what was the begging of the end...Rather than the more typical 45mins, my delivery was well over an hour. By the time my pizza finally arrived, it wasn't nice and fresh, but all congealed and the crust was soggy in the middle.

Sigh. I thought it was just because it was a busy weekend...

Episode 2: Delivery took over an hour. I answer the door, buzz the guy in and he just sits there waiting for me. It shouldn't matter that I live on the 3rd floor. I'm lounging around in my sweats, relaxing and watching movies...If I wanted to find my jacket, put on shoes and go down to the street, I WOULD HAVE GOTTEN INTO MY OWN DAMN CAR AND PICKED IT UP MYSELF. Delivery means *to my door*. Not to my building, to my street or the bottom of the stairs at the end of my building. To top it off? He was surly with me for having to wait. Are you kidding me? I did pizza delivery for 4 years full time. It's not hard work you lazy fuck.

But I was probably just unlucky. Off night with a driver who clearly wouldn't last long. Besides, everyone has an off night right? Wrong!

Episode3: I'm planning on working through the weekend and want lots of leftovers...and some dessert! So I ring up Pronto for an order of wings, pizza and a couple slices of cake. Again, over an hour to deliver, same bum of a driver won't come to my door, and it appears they've charged me $12 for two pieces of cake?!? So now I have to stand around in the cold while this guy tries to call back to his office to work it out....

It eventually gets done, but too little too late. If I want delivery, I want an effing delivery. If I have to walk down to my car anyhow, what's the point? There are much better places I can do take out from.

Sorry Pronto. I won't be calling again.
author: Erich N.

description:
$1.85 for a slice for a slice of some GOOD thin crust cheese pizza?

HELL YEAH.
author: kate r.

description:
Had this pizza last night, it was good for the price. Medium Cheese with sausage and ordered their Garlic Bread with Melted Cheese for about $17 dollars .

Watch out on the garlic bread with melted cheese its has a lot of garlic on it. But all in all its was good, they said 30 minutes, it took me 20 minutes to get there and it was ready when i got there.
author: Ryan L.

description: Pronto pizza is another quick and easy pizza place in SF. Great for late nights or for picking up a slice when you're on the go. The staff is pretty friendly. Expected bill: $4.
author: Tushar K.

description: 1 star for big portions. 1 star for cheap prices. If it's late and you're broke and famished, you probably still won't enjoy the food. If it's late and you're broke and famished and not sober, go ahead and try this place. Be prepared for rude employees. I won't be going back.
author: Andria M.

description:
I like their sandwiches. It's good, and cheap, and big.

DO NOT ORDER SALAD. It's worse than you can imagine.

I think their pizza is just OK. I know lots of people likes their pizza.
I don't dislike them but it doesn't taste that special either.
author: Green Mango Y.

description: It's New Year's Eve and there are tons of drunk people on the street. The line is already going out the door because every drunk person wants a good slice of pizza. As we stumble back to my friend's apartment, I have the sudden craving pizza - particularly Pronto Pizza because it's probably one of the only pizza places still open in the area. After a good half hour of discussion, we decide to spontaneously order 4 extra large pizzas for pick-up. Total cost is $60 for less than 10 people. We weren't thinking straight and thought it was a great deal. We phoned in the four orders: mushroom and sausage, pesto, ham and pepperoni, and another one which I can't remember. At the time, the pizza tasted like the best thing on the planet, but then again, we were hungry and our standards were off par. Not a bad meal to end a drunken night of debauchery. The mushroom and sausage was the best followed by the ham and pepperoni. They place the ham and pepperoni underneath their cheese so is a pretty nice surprise to bite into. My only complaint was that the crust wasn't all that great.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Four stars for the fact that they are:

a) open ridiculously late
b) funnily enough, they are pronto as hell
c) they have a great selection of toppings

A side note on b, they are USUALLY fast. Take last night for instance, I ordered my pie and the guy was here in thirty minutes maximum. I was so suprised by his speed i hadn't even dried off from the shower. Kudos for that. but sometimes the planets will unalign and they will take their time.

Again, the toppings are many and good. Especially the feta, garlic and clams. Get them, be adventurous, eat you crazy kids.
author: Jay C.

description:
Picture this: Halloween night, after 10 pm... my guy and I are hungry. I didn't want to be in a bar because I wasn't in the mood to deal with douchebags, I was starving because someone decided he wanted to be frisky and then NAP afterwards... I didn't mind the frisk, just minded the nap.

I'm actually close to picking Burger King at this point because at least the food would be warm and I wouldn't feel like someone will have to carry me home, and every other place is closed. That's when I spy Pronto's and the man takes the lead. I let him order after informing him pizza just wasn't going to do it, and get introduced to my first philly cheesesteak due to him being a transplanted Boston-Philly boy.

Yum. I don't know how else to put it, and it might just be because I was hungry and anything looked good. All I know is that it rocked and I was happy when we headed back home.
author: Nikki M.

description:
What do you expect from a small local take out pizza place open late night?  It does take a while to get a custom order pizza because they add the toppings right there and put it in the oven right in front of you.  

Go for the pizza already sliced and placed under the glass counter.  It's fast, cheap, and super convenient!
author: Kristina P.

description: I just ordered a cheese burger and some hot wings at 11:35 pm for delivery.  The cheese burger patty looked and tasted like it was someone's order that was never paid for and they just heated it up and sent it to me.  The cheese was not fresh but was hard like it has been cooked but sat around for awhile already.  The lettuce in the cheese burger was just a few small 1x1 and 1x2 inches of lettuce that looked as if they just took maybe 4-5 pieces from their salad dishes.  worst burger I ever had.  Even fast food burgers never tasted this bad.
author: Phamongkoun L.

description: best food place in the city for delivery. We have had some really crappy delivery experiences in this city. Prontos is our go to place, the pizza is good deals are good and they are very friendly. the delivery guy is quick. I would recommend Prontos to anyone.
author: Elizabeth F.

description: Super Veggie slice = Super amazing! They hand make their pizza on the spot, letting you see what exactly they are putting on the slice before they cook it up (other places simply reheat slices of premade pizza). The slice was huge, heated just right and simply superb! Get at it!
author: Haz O.

description: I've gotten decent delivery pizza from Pronto on a few occasions. But the other night it took nearly an hour and a half (they promise 35-45 minutes) to get a pizza that turned out not to be the one I ordered. I called once to follow up and they said "He'll be here any minute." Another half an hour later, when I was furious and ravenous, the delivery guy finally showed up. I said "I don't mean to be crabby with YOU, but..." and described the delay. He shrugged "Do whatever you want" (presumably re: tip), and when I asked "Wait...is this a large?" because that's what I'd ordered, he said "No, it's a medium" and just ran back to his car. I emailed Pronto to complain, but they haven't responded yet. Last pizza I'll be ordering from them.
author: Doubledang D.

description:
Okay, let me explain why I'm giving such a low rating to a pizza place I used to hold so dear. 

They're open late. They deliver for free. They accept online orders. They take cards. They're down the street from my house. 

At least, that was the Pronto I used to know. The great chefs who never messed anything up are long gone, replaced by an entitled and disgruntled staff who _always_  get the order wrong. My order shows up without the drinks I ordered, I get phone calls asking how to get into my building (hint: try the intercom, like every other downtown SF apartment building that has that funny little phone on the gate), and last time I ate in the restaurant, I saw the guy making pizzas burn his hand/arm on the oven and then shortly thereafter plunge his bare hand deep into the toppings to put them on top of my pizza. I'm sure it was just psychological, but christ, I can't get over the fact that I potentially ate some dude's hand-skin. GROSS.

Pizza used to be great. Now it's so-so. Delivery is usually timely. Night time staff is WAY better than day time staff. Pizza always tastes reheated and congealed now. I hope Pronto's management reads this and fixes things for its former devotees. 

"What happened to you, man? You used to be cool..."
author: Nicole L.

description:
Great tasting pizza at any time... especially good for late night snacks when one comes back from the bars. The people are friendly enough and the prices are relatively cheap. $2.50 for a big slice of pepperoni.

One thing to note, the pizza is pretty greasy, but I kind of like that. ;)
author: Dave S.

description:
Thin pizza with skimpy toppings. I counted about three slices of mushrooms on one slice - cheap, cheap.
Save your money and order from Serrano's - they ar much better.
Must be american owned - and putting everything on a scale.

:)  :)
author: Mod S.

description:
Holy wow, they are definitely pronto! So far I haven't ventured away from the cheese pizza selection (both the thin crust and the deep dish are yummy), but I have been pleasantly surprised by the combination of speediness and quality both times I've ordered.

Hot, fresh pizza at my door in (seriously) 20 minutes. Can't beat that.
author: Heather M.

description: Best Pizza in Civic Center. Can go in and order by the slice anykind you want the pesto sauce is very good. Really good deals one of which is 2 cans soda 2-topping large and a dinner sald for $19.99 .Used to get it all the time.
author: S M.

description:
6-10-11
Excellent phone service!
I called from a bad phone, gave them half my phone number and then needed to c/b from a better phone.  the same guy picked up immediately confirmed the first numbers and asked for the rest.--without blinking an eye-very quick--actively listened and paraphrased well!!--great listening and verbal communication skills!!--took the order quickly but at my pace!!

Speedy delivery!
Pizza was right on time as I was told--45 minutes to the second--from their place on eddy and van ness to my apt at julian and 16th--including cooking time!!  I am impressed!

Great Delivery Guy!
Delivery guy forgot the second 2 litre of soda but was able to think outside the box! He went to the corner store and came back with it-- no hassle!!  He apologized 2x and thanked me for the order! He made sure the fact that he had no extra soda on him was his problem and not mine!

Taste Great! 
I ordered a simple medium sausage and ham pizza.  It was perfect!
Chief Ramsey of Hell's Kitchen fame would be impressed.  The bread dough was Fresh.  The ham and sausage toppings were delicious.  Not spicy for my standard american favorite yet not bland like the other pizza delivery places!  I could taste the different ingredients well--the ham, sausage, sauce, spices and dough which made a huge delicious difference compared to the other guys like Dominos!

Summary!
Please don't tell me I got these guys on a good day cause they are usually bad.  I wont believe it!  Too many common ways to screw up an order and they did none of it!  Dominos may be a different story.
But we'll just keep that to ourselves:)
author: c g.

description: Excellent pizza, with a diverse selection of toppings, including Pesto, my favorite. Superb hospitality, these guys are always laid back, and helpful. And awesome, meaty, juicy hot wings! Sooo, goood!
author: Tyler K.

description: They deliver until 3 AM. That's what you really need to know. The pizza is decent - not awful, not great - just decent. I'd stick with their pizza and garlic bread. The salads aren't very fresh. However, if you're up that late and need a snack it's a great place.
author: Marissa P.

description: Nothing special about this pizza, but it's not bad. Workers there are friendly. Slice of pepperoni $3.03 after everything.
author: vishal k.

description: reverse back late friday night...late night hunger...order of a flyer special...$seventeen.ninety-nine pizza and liter soda delivery...pronto!..order and fair wait....call from driver searching for home....running out to flag down pizza delivery man...$twenty-one given....box and soda in hand...quick pizza to the face....another pizza to the face....fairly thin crust and satisfied....standard pizza pie cooked fine...gulp of diet coke...another pizza straight to the face...full and passing out for the night...same sofa spot eating laying....with pizza still in mouth chewing...sleep...
author: Hen A.

description:
I don't know what the jokers below are talking about, but this is my favorite pizza place in the city.  I work close by, so it's not out of the question that I eat here twice a week.  

The pizza is excellent and so is the staff that works there.  Really cool guys that take the place seriously.  Very appreciative of the business they get, and totally recognize you if you're a regular there.  

I haven't had the sandwiches, but a coworker said they're pretty good as well.  If you get a pizza delivered, it's still pretty good, but I recommend going in if you can stand the neighborhood.  

Good pizza, REALLY cheap.  That's all you can really ask for.
author: Adam C.

description: Want a greasy pizza delivered to your door at 1am after a night of drinking?  These are your guys.  The pizza isn't anything amazing, but you don't expect it to be at 1am.  Delivery guys are quick, and pizza is always piping hot.  Online ordering is convenient as always.  Prices are a LITTLE high, but the late hours and good service justify them in my opinion.
author: Joshua W.

description: Worst pizza I've ever had.  I'm never picky about pizza, but this one was inedibly bad.
author: Kicker ..

description:
I can't speak for the by-the-slice pizza that is premade and sitting under the hot lamps because I always order fresh, and it's always really good. My favorite is the Greco pizza, I highly reccomend it. I also had the bbq chicken pizza, which is also very good, except it comes with A LOT of onions, so beware. 

Also, you can't beat the deal that they have at lunch time of a slice of pizza, a salad and a drink for around $5. The pizza slices are huge too, which is amazing. Pronto pizza always has nice clear english speaking people working the phones, which is amazing.
author: Chad D.

description:
After debating over where to oder pizza with my good friend, we reluctantly decided upon Pronto.  
We waited for our delivery (which was not pronto in the least) and were greeted with a tasteless and unsatisfying pizza.  When grabbing for a slice, all of the bland toppings sadly slipped off leaving nothing but dough and a thin layer of sauce.  
We had hope for the mozzarella sticks...until we bit into them.  4 out of 6 were EMPTY!!! Nothing but fried dough.  Which I ate.  Because I was hungry.  

This all happened mere minutes ago, and we immediately hopped online to warn our fellow Yelpers.  Pizza that makes you say, "Mehhhhh".
author: Caitlin S.

description: Pronto Pizza, My fairy godmother. Delivering pizza to drunk, hungry, horny kids at 4am.
author: Alexis M.

description: Seriously fast free delivery pizza. Definitely the best in the SOMA area in that department and also the best tasting... Yes I am talking to you SOMA Pizza, et al. I think the longest I have ever waited on them is 20 minutes. Best feature though is that you can order at sfprontopizza.com and not have to worry about them hearing something wrong over the phone. Plus there are lots of coupons on the site that you can apply to your order and no matter what you want to eat, one will always apply to you. Last time I got a large pie covered with fresh basil and fresh garlic. Delicious. Highly Recommended.
author: Jennie H.

description:
the fools that work here seems like tough
eastern european terrorist/gangsters
but they are actually super nice dudes.
and they help to keep this place from being
infested with tenderloin barnacle scummies.

JT says: hands down SAFEST late night spot
in my neck of the TL for a cheap slice.

-THE MORE YOU KNOW-

ambiance is not so much though
but the prices are most agreeable
and the beverage selection is respectable.

and of course, 30 seconds away from 
the JT fortress of solitude.

rating = 3 out of 5 frat guys would
choose prontos over a keg stand!

BONUS! JT slice secret combination: 
salami, shrimp, pineapple, mushroom.
a winner is YOU.
author: JT X.

description: My local pizza joint.  I give 2 stars for not kicking me out every time I am a jerk and talk to the customers or the police taking things away from their customers.  I try to be quiet, I'm sorry, I only come here at like1:30 AM after being in the TL for hours.  They are as nice as they can be, to me.  Their pizza is big and full of toppings, I like that they are ready for you late at night. I will eat any and every type of pizza they have, perfect for that late night snack. Thanks Pronto, I will behave next time, or at least try to =)
author: Megan L.

description: i visited SF for the weekend. on Saturday night, my mouth met Pronto Pizza. I was very drunk, but not too drunk to undetect the amazing taste of pronto pizza. perfect ratio of cheese, olives, marinara, and even grease. also key was the perfect temperature. if i could FedEx a Pronto Pizza to Minneapolis, I'd do it all the time. or, i would fly myself in a helicopter to eat it at my pleasure.
author: Susan A.

description: For what it is, it's good. I love the spaghetti and meatballs, the meat lasagna (a must-order, the sausage and ricotta are fabulous). I had a grilled chicken sandwich that was tasty but too dry. Their chicken wings are nothing special, but I enjoy them. Once, the delivery person was lazy and wouldn't get out of his car. But the second time they buzzed my door and came up the elevator to my floor. Which was very nice. Also, once they forgot my salad and made a complete return trip to deliver it - thanks Pronto! I hope they remain consistent. It's not mind blowing but for what it is, basic, tasty, inexpensive - it satisfies.
author: Brianna W.

description:
i don't know what the inside of this place looks like, but the delivery time and quality of pie at 2:30 in the morning is worth four stars alone. i'm talking full pizza pie with great garlic bread--none of that slice talk. 
must we all be so pretentious when it comes to our pizza? let's get over ourselves and realize that anyone working these late hours for a pizza joint only to deliver to drunken idiots a quality meal deserves all our respect.
author: the r-o- b.

description: I've been here several times, albeit after a few rounds of Whiskey Thieves each time, and I always end up leaving this place wanting more.  I've tried their Pepperoni and Combo - both are great.
author: Sid M.

description: Pretty good pizza, they had an extensive toppings list. Their salad was nothing special but I had no complaints. The price was right too, you cant really beat it. Staff was friendly and I would love to come here again if I can't get into Tomaso's like was the case the other day.
author: Chris B.

description: Got delivery. Took about 30 minutes. He had the spaghetti with meatballs dinner; came w/ garlic cheese bread and a small salad. I had the veggie sandwich (no marinara sauce). Used my "free 2 liter soda" coupon. Total 15.61  + tip for a grand total of $20 The food was all really good. The spaghetti sauce was surprisingly delicious - just the right amt of chunkiness and not at all watery. The garlic cheese bread was super - lots of flavor without any grease. The delivery guy had a hard time using my front door entry system and also couldn't find my apartment. But, all in all, the food was very good, so would definitely recommend and will definitely order again.
author: Maren P.

description: Nope, nope, nope. Thin crust should not be floppy crust. This shit remiinds me of the disks I used to throw inside an old school mac to play oregon trail or math munchers when I was in 2nd grade. Do not want.
author: Tommy P.

description: I don't know why all these other Yelpers are getting weird about the dough. No other similar pizza place I've been to in the City--you know, the fast, by-the-slice, seedy delivery place--can measure up to Pronto. Fat Slice is greasy and disgusting, New York is too thin and carboardy, the place a block up in TL is always too crispy, but somehow Pronto always does their slices just... perfect. A huge variety of toppings and a connected cafe, plus a ready arsenal of Juice Squeeze in their fridge make this my favorite low-budget pizza place in SF--and they deliver.
author: Maxine Y.

description: I haven't visited the restaurant itself, but in terms of delivery, this place is pretty rockin. The food is always delivered fast and hot, let alone being quite tasty. I would have given them five stars for their extensive menu, but they charge double for artichoke hearts - the first pizza place that I have seen doing that.
author: Victoria K.

description: Large Thin Crust Cheese Pizza was kick ass!!!!  I don't consider myself super-picky (I mean, I'm not from NY or anything) -- but I have had a hard time finding pizza I like in the city.  This was good!  And quick delivery.... I didn't love the other type of pizza I ordered - the Tuscany - it had too many toppings for my taste and it was supposed to come with pesto sauce but instead came with red sauce.... oh well  - I will stick with the cheese!
author: A B.

description: Loved the pomodoro pizza. Added spinach. Great wood-fired taste nod thin crust. A perfect proportion of garlic, spinach, pancetta and tomatoes. Best pizza I've had in this area since moving here. My husband's pepperoni and mushroom was really good as well. Wish they delivered to Belmont.
author: Jakki G.

description: I was pretty surprised at what was there when I opened the pizza box-- hot, delicious pizza ! Their thin pizza with pepperoni, tomatoes and bell peppers is perfect ! The pizza is not to oily and not too salty . Yum~ One bad thing about them is that their chicken is cooked in the foil with spices . (or, at least that's what I think) When I opened the foil, the chicken was pretty much almost all black & burnt, however, it wasn't oily at all-- great spices too . Pretty good .
author: Jenny Y.

description: They deliver late and have OK pizza. Good if it's late, you're hungry, and you have limited options. Delivery took about 45 minutes which is about what I was quoted. I've had better, I've had worse. This one is right down the middle.
author: Sidney B.

description: slow. dirty. expensive for the quality. homeless people walking in and pushing you aside to look through the garbage. ick.
author: Ramon E.

description: i have never ordered delivery from these guys i have only walked in and bought slices and ate them there.  i love the size of the slices and the thin crust.  they are more reasonable per slice than many other pizza places.
author: Dan S.

description: So I decided to try a new pizza delivery joint in my area last Saturday night and gave Pronto a shot.  I had walked by a few times and noticed it but have never tried it out.  Well I went with their Mexicano pizza pie and a Greek salad and was pleased all around.  On time and pleasant service, I'll be trying them again.
author: Derek D.

description: I give this pizza place three stars for the nice, friendly staff. Since this place is just around the corner from me in the Auto, the pizza is good enough for a late night craving, but unfortunately wouldn't be my first choice for pizza. Too dough-ey.
author: Tan E.

description:
my favorite thing about pronto is the meal- a slice of pizza, a salad, and soda for like... five dollars i think?
the pizza itself isnt as good as chicos, but if youre in the TL its worth the stop.
author: Becca M.

description: Pronto may not be fast hence "pronto" Lol The name makes me laugh at times. But the pizza is of Bronx, New York style pizza with the casual latin/itailian/indian pizza makers on hand. The pizza is good and sloopy like a new york style should be but if you go in for a quick bite or take out order; the establishment is definitely not easy on the eyes. Could be a lot cleaner! So if your just plain out-right hungry for crub this is the place to go if you wanna enjoy and eat  a slice with pigeons at the picking order...Trust me, one or two statements I have  attested and stated in this review will be at some point concluded by yourself truly!
author: Michael H.

description: Delivery for this place is normally very fast and the pizza is always hot. They are open later than most places which is great when you are drunk. The crust is not that good and the toppings seem to be rather low quality. I would give this place a 2 but since they are opened late I'll give them a 3.
author: Tom A.

description: Not even trying to be a hater. Hella whack pizza....I think the pizza at costco even tastes better and thats saying a lot.
author: Tommy B.

description: Amazing pizza but even more amazing tasty and healthy grilled paninis.  Great spot for tasty lunch or late nite eats.
author: Maryann H.

description:
Like everyone else reports, fast delivery.  Very friendly deliveryman.  Cheap.

The pizza (sausage, olives, bell pepper) was not too tasty in my opinion.  Way too salty for one thing.  And the cheese slid off the pie every time I picked up a slice.  Cheese all over the box, slice nothing but crust with a soggy tomato-based cover.  

So, I gathered the cheese and toppings from the box and placed it on the pie.  Not the worst of fates, but why?  

I also ordered a greek salad, which was generic.
author: drummond b.

description:
Best late night delivery i have had in this pizza hating town. It was good, ok really good, needed a little more cheese on the pizza, and could have used more salad dressing on the large salad. (I'm a skinny guy, need to keep those calories up!)

But these are all things you can fix with correct ordering. I.e. extra cheese extra dressing.

Anyway, I'll order again, and i'll let you all know...
author: Derek d.

description: i love pronto and 1 bad experience wont make me stop ordering from them, but today was a bad experience. 1st off, it took an hour and a half to deliver a pizza and lasagna 5 blocks away on a normal saturday. bullshit, they forgot my order and just didnt want to admit. 2nd, when the order FINALLY came they brought me a beef lasagna instead of chicken! some might say "who cares?" well i do, because i dont eat beef! low and behold, it only took them about 15 minutes to bring the chicken one over which confirms that they forgot my earlier order. i didnt even get a discount or anything and the guy i was complaining to on the phone was kind of rude. a hungry drewy = a mean drewy. deal with it...
author: Andrew T.

description: I lived in New York and loved "NY style" pizza. Many places in California claim to make NY style - thin crust pies, most of them don't even know what they're talking about. Pronto Pizza doesn't brag or make false claims, but they do make great thin crust pizza pies!
author: Jessica J.

description: zero ambiance, but workers are super nice and thats not to be expected at a ghetto pizza joint anyway. on the real,  i have to defend this place. although the crust is not a scrumptious meal itself, it is the perfect texture. i like the "cornmeal" on top and easily chewable crust. this is not your crunchy type, so as long as u know that u wont be disappointed. perfect amount of cheese too. if u ask me, its a nice slice.
author: Ligaya T.

description: runs a lil behind on schedule but the pizza is pretty good for what it is. tried the vegetarian with added garlic :)
author: King B.

description: Nothing pronto about this place. We ordered a pizza last night, the guy said 45 minutes for it to be delivered. After an hour I called to see where the pizza was, he said "oh we just put it in the oven, it will be there in 20 minutes" It took another hour before the pizza was delivered. I'm giving it 1 star because the pizza was hot. But really? 2 hours and 20 minutes to deliver a pizza. and they still made me pay for it. Next time I'm calling Mr. Pizza man
author: Courtney M.
